Method Detail

dumpColumn

void dumpColumn(int i,
                java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                int rsi)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
This method will set the value in the output report at the i-th position and taking the rsi-th position value from the specified result set.

Parameters:
i - The report output column index.
rs - The result set where to get the data.
rsi - The result set index number where to get the value from.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - in case of database related problems.

The first output column index is 0.

The first result set column index is 1.

dumpColumn

void dumpColumn(int i,
                java.sql.ResultSet rs)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
This method will set the value in the output report at the i-th position and taking the i-th position value from the specified result set.

Parameters:
i - The report output column index.
rs - The result set where to get the data.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - in case of database related problems.

The first output column index is 1.

nextRow

void nextRow()
             throws java.io.IOException
Move the output processing to the next row. The highlightArray is replaced with null. The row number is increased and the actual column is set to the base column value.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

finish

void finish()
            throws java.io.IOException
This method have to be called after all the target related data are dumped.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

setColumnPosition

void setColumnPosition(int column)
Shift the actual column position by the specified number of columns.

setHighlightArray

void setHighlightArray(int[] highlightArray)
This method sets up the array that determines the highlighting of the actually processed row.

Parameters:
highlightArray -

The highlight array will be erased by the call to nextRow method.

setColumnPosition

void setColumnPosition(int column,
                       int step,
                       int[] highlightArray)
This method sets the column position for setColumn function. The position have to be specified relatively to the baseColumn position.

Parameters:
column - The relative position to baseColumn.
step - The number of cells to be skipped between column i and i+1.
highlightArray - The array which determines the highlighting of the columns in the row actually processed.

dumpColumn

void dumpColumn(int i,
                java.lang.Object o,
                BuilderInterface.CellFormat cellFormat)
Store the specified object into the result column of the current row.

Parameters:
i - The column index relative to actColumn position.
o - The object which value should be stored.
cellFormat - The change in the cell formatting.

The method will automatically determine the highlight color to be used.

dumpColumn

void dumpColumn(int i,
                java.lang.Object o,
                BuilderInterface.CellFormat cellFormat,
                boolean highlight)
Store the specified object into the result column of the current row.

Parameters:
i - The column index relative to actColumn position.
o - The object which value should be stored.
cellFormat - The change in the cell formatting.
highlight - Indicates whether to highlight the cell content.
